edu.mines.jtk.sgl
Class PickResult

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.sgl.PickResult

public class PickResult
extends java.lang.Object

A result from a pick traversal.

A pick result has a list of nodes, ordered parent to child, that represents the path from the root node to the picked node. The last node in the list is the picked node.

A pick result also has a point of intersection with a pick shape. This point may be obtained in either the local or world coordinate system, and its depth (z) may be obtained in pixel coordinates.

Version:
2005.06.17
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

Constructor Detail

PickResult

public PickResult(PickContext pc,
                  Point3 point)
Constructs a new pick result in the specified context.

Parameters:
pc - the pick context.
point - the picked point, in local coordinates.
Method Detail

getMouseEvent

public java.awt.event.MouseEvent getMouseEvent()
Gets the mouse event for this pick result. This is the mouse event of the pick context for which this pick result was constructed.

Returns:
the mouse event.

getNodes

public Node[] getNodes()
Gets the array of nodes in this result. The nodes are ordered parent to child; the last node in the array is the picked node.

Returns:
the array of nodes; by copy, not by reference.

getNode

public Node getNode()
Gets the picked node in this result. The picked node is the last node in the list (ordered parent to child) of nodes in this pick result.

Returns:
the picked node.

getDragableNode

public Dragable getDragableNode()
Gets a node in this result that is dragable. The node returned is the last node in the list (ordered parent to child) of nodes in this pick result that implements the interface Dragable. If no such node exists, this method returns null.

Returns:
the dragable node; null, if none.

getSelectableNode

public Selectable getSelectableNode()
Gets a node in this result that is selectable. The node returned is the last node in the list (ordered parent to child) of nodes in this pick result that implements the interface Selectable. If no such node exists, this method returns null.

Returns:
the selectable node; null, if none.

getNode

public Node getNode(java.lang.Class<?> nodeClass)
Gets a node in this result that is an instance of the specified class. The node returned is the last node in the list (ordered parent to child) of nodes in this pick result that is an instance of the specified class. If no such node exists, this method returns null.

Returns:
the node; null, if none.

public Point3 getPointPixel()
Gets the picked point in pixel coordinates.

Returns:
the picked point in pixel coordinates.

getPixelZ

public double getPixelZ()
Gets the pixel z (depth) coordinate of the picked point. This depth depth coordinate increases from 0.0 at the near clipping plane to 1.0 at the far clipping plane.

Returns:
the pixel z coordinate.
